de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface ButtonBarDialogDecorator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Dialog
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ButtonBarDialog, ListDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractButtonBarDialog, AbstractListDialog, ButtonBarDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog, ProgressDialog

    public interface ButtonBarDialogDecorator
extends Dialog
    Defines the interface, a decorator, which allows to modify the view hierarchy of a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons, must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0

      • Methods inherited from interface de.mrapp.android.dialog.model.Dialog

        getContext

    • Method Detail

      • getButton

        Button getButton(int whichButton)
        Returns one of the buttons, which is shown by the dialog.
        Parameters:
        whichButton - The identifier of the button, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The identifier must either be DialogInterface#BUTTON_POSITIVE, DialogInterface#BUTTON_NEGATIVE or DialogInterface#BUTTON_NEUTRAL
        Returns:
        The button, which corresponds to the given identifier, as an instance of the class Button or null, if the button is not shown or if the dialog has not been shown yet

      • setPositiveButton

        void setPositiveButton(@Nullable
                       java.lang.CharSequence text,
                       @Nullable
                       DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the text of the positive button of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        text - The text, which should be set, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no positive button should be shown
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the positive button is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setPositiveButton

        void setPositiveButton(@StringRes
                       int resourceId,
                       @Nullable
                       DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the text of the positive button of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the text, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the positive button is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

                       java.lang.CharSequence text,

        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the negative button is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • areButtonsStacked

        boolean areButtonsStacked()
        Returns, whether the buttons of the dialog are aligned vertically, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the buttons of the dialog are aligned vertically, false otherwise

      • stackButtons

        void stackButtons(boolean stackButtons)
        Sets, whether the buttons of the dialog should be aligned vertically, or not.
        Parameters:
        stackButtons - True, if the buttons of the dialog should be aligned vertically, false otherwise

      • getButtonTextColor

        int getButtonTextColor()
        Returns the color of the button texts of the dialog.
        Returns:
        The color of the button texts of the dialog as an Integer value or -1, if no custom color has been set

      • setButtonTextColor

        void setButtonTextColor(int color)
        Sets the color of the button texts of the dialog.
        Parameters:
        color - The color, which should be set, as an Integer value

      • isButtonBarDividerShown

        boolean isButtonBarDividerShown()
        Returns, whether the divider, which is located above the dialog's buttons, is shown, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if the divider, which is located above the dialog's buttons, is shown, false otherwise

      • showButtonBarDivider

        void showButtonBarDivider(boolean show)
        Sets, whether the divider, which is located above the dialog's buttons, should be shown, or not.
        Parameters:
        show - True, if the divider, which is located above the dialog's buttons, should be show, false otherwise
